The paragraph heading is amended to include rules, certain non federally funded coverage for children is specified, and no exclusion of children with access to high-cost coverage is allowed. Additionally, a State cannot exclude a child as a targeted vulnerable child based on high coverage costs exceeding 5 percent of the family's income. Conforming amendments are made to Titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act. The insurance coverage for vulnerable children in the child's family should not exceed 5 percent of the family's income. Amendments are made to Titles XIX and XXI of the Social Security Act, and the effective date is October 1, 2004. SEC. 3. Increase in federal financial participation under SCHIP and Medicaid for states with simplified enrollment and renewal procedures for children. Increase in federal financial participation under SCHIP and Medicaid for states with simplified enrollment and renewal procedures for children, including the nonapplication of limitations on expenditures for outreach strategies. The State can increase the enhanced FMAP by 5 percentage points for outreach strategies for children under title XIX, including presumptive eligibility. The State must provide presumptive eligibility, 12-month continuous eligibility, eliminate asset tests, and allow for passive renewal for children under title XIX and title XIX. The State does not require asset tests for children's eligibility under title XIX or title XIX. Passive renewal is allowed for children's assistance if no changes are reported, subject to verification from State databases. Medicaid section 1902(l) of the Social Security Act is amended to include this provision. The Medicaid section 1902(l) of the Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for outreach strategies for children under 19 years of age eligible for medical assistance. This includes presumptive eligibility and enhanced Federal medical assistance percentage. The State must implement outreach strategies for children under title XXI, including presumptive eligibility, 12-month continuous eligibility, elimination of asset test, and passive renewal of eligibility. The amendments made by this section allow for automatic renewal of eligibility for assistance under title XXI if no changes are reported, effective October 1, 2004. SEC. 4 amends the Social Security Act to increase funding for SCHIP and eliminates the SCHIP DIP. The amendments take effect on October 1, 2004. SEC. 5 imposes a limitation on payments to states with enrollment caps that have not used up their available allotments. The Social Security Act is amended to limit payments to states with enrollment caps that have not fully expended their available allotments for child health assistance. The amendments made by this section take effect on October 1, 2004. The Social Security Act is amended to apply Medicaid managed care requirements to SCHIP, effective October 1, 2004.
